articleContent.title: Chord: 11th in F (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 11th in F (Shape: D)

## Brief Description
The 11th chord in the key of F is represented by the D shape on the guitar. It is a rich and colorful chord that adds complexity and sophistication to your music. 

## Notes and Intervals
The 11th chord in F played with the D shape consists of the following notes and intervals:
- F (Root)
- A (Minor Third)
- C (Perfect Fifth)
- G (Major 6th)
- Bb (Major 9th)
- D (Perfect 11th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 11th chord in F, played with the D shape, is commonly found in jazz, R&B, funk, and soul music. It adds a jazzy and soulful flavor to your compositions, creating a lush and sophisticated sound. This chord is often used to create tension and release in the music, adding depth and interest to the harmonic structure. 

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the 11th chord in F played with the D shape:
1. "Red Clay" by Freddie Hubbard
2. "A Love Supreme" by John Coltrane
3. "Don't You Worry 'Bout a Thing" by Stevie Wonder

These songs showcase how the 11th chord in F can be used to create a unique harmonic texture and enhance the musical experience.
